intro: Chiococca cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban chiococca, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Cuba. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, white flowers are clustered in cymes and are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Chiococca cubensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky crevices.
